page.title: 08Warslow Police Station
page.content: There are 5 people employed at Warslow Police Station - 4 constables and a female sergeant. One constable lives in one of the two Police Houses next to the station. The duties of the police are to protect the public and their property. The police in Warslow are called out mostly to attend road accidents. With Warslow being a rural area the Police have to make sure that the local sheep are dipped correctly. They also have a duty to check that fire-arm licences are renewed properly. There is a Special Constable attached to the station, whose job is to help the regular police, mainly in directing traffic when it is busy. The station has one police car, two vans, one landrover and a bicycle. The vehicles are replaced every 4 years and do about 25,000 miles per year.
